abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability highly likely, although the institutional
            development impact is rated modest. The main lesson learned
            pertains to the importance of an adequate policy and/or
            regulatory environment. Key to timely implementation is
            incentive, either of the carrot or stick variety, a lesson
            that is hardly new. And key to incentive is an enabling
            policy, and regulatory environment, in this case the
            necessity of regulatory compulsion. The lesson of incentive
            applies not only to the demand side, but also the supply
            side. The Industrial Development Bank of India (IDBI), as
            the sole intermediary, did not have the pressure of
            competition on the supply side. But including a second
            intermediary may not have been feasible in the present case,
            however, given the relatively small size of the umbrella.
            There is also a lesson of management process, which is
            critical to timely implementation. Best practice suggests
            organizing and running a project launch workshop, to bring
            potential beneficiaries up to speed on the project and what
            is offered, and how to go about availing of it. Likewise,
            best practice suggests preparing a project implementation
            manual (PIM) to lend clarity to the process, and thereby
            surpass avoidable delays. Finally, it may be remarked that
            IDBI stayed engaged and committed, although their
            remuneration turned out to be less than anticipated, and the
            burden of work greater. The lesson here is perhaps that some
            enterprises take their commitments seriously, even when
            these may not be to their benefit at times. There is much to
            be said for a long-term partnership, and, the Bank's
            investment in the relationship with IDBI has been an
            important aspect of the highly successful Montreal Protocol
            program in India over 12 years.
